bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 34 (Tuesday, February 23, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GARAMENDI:H.R. 1230.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution[Page H588]

item.name: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Subcommittee

item.title: Protecting America's Wilderness and Public Lands Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.name: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands Subcommittee

Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E156)

summary.text: This bill adjusts the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta National Heritage Area in California to include the area identified as the Rio Vista/Expansion Area on the map entitled Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta National Heritage Area Proposed Boundary Expansion and dated February 2021.

bill.title: To adjust the boundary of the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta National Heritage Area, and for other purposes.

item.title: To adjust the boundary of the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta National Heritage Area, and for other purposes.
To adjust the boundary of the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta National Heritage Area, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
